items.title: 'Money today or blood tomorrow': EU leaders urged to act on frozen Russian assets
items.summary: European leaders meeting in Belgium are trying to negotiate a deal to use frozen Russian ‍assets to finance Ukraine's war effort.

items.title: Coping with grief after the Bondi Beach massacre: What can help in the days after tragedy
items.summary: Experts say the Bondi Beach shooting can affect many, as the nervous system struggles to distinguish between perceived and actual trauma.

items.title: Albanese 'failed to act' on antisemitism Ley says, as government proposes new laws
items.summary: The government will accept a report from the antisemitism envoy in full and introduce a raft of new laws in the wake of the Bondi terror attack.

items.title: Discrimination concerns as government flags migration reform after Bondi attack
items.summary: As part of its response to the Bondi Beach attack, which claimed 15 lives, the government will review its migration settings.

items.title: More than 1,000 civilians killed in raid on Sudanese displacement camp, UN finds
items.summary: A UN report has found 1,000 civilians were killed when a Sudanese paramilitary group overran a famine-stricken Darfur displacement camp.

items.title: Matilda, a young victim of Bondi massacre, farewelled as families offered funds
items.summary: The youngest victim, 10-year-old Matilda, has been remembered as a bright and spirited girl.

items.title: Australia's Christmas weather forecast has landed. Here's what to expect in your city
items.summary: Before you plan a big Christmas lunch outdoors, it might be a good idea to see what the weather is looking like in your city this 25 December.

items.title: Sydney man banned from Bondi over alleged antisemitic threats on Bali flight
items.summary: The incident comes just days after the deadly attack on members of the Jewish community at Bondi Beach.

items.title: These are the victims of the Bondi Beach terror attack
items.summary: Funerals have commenced for the 15 people killed in a terror attack at Bondi Beach.

items.title: Optus failed to act on early warning signs during triple-zero outage, review finds
items.summary: Optus has promised to implement 21 recommendations from an independent review into the outage that has been linked to two deaths.

items.title: Cricket shirts and fake Hanson quotes: How false information spread after the Bondi attack
items.summary: Misinformation and disinformation have been circulated widely since Sunday's massacre.

items.title: How does your day compare? Here's how Australians are spending their time
items.summary: Almost 10,700 Australians were surveyed, revealing both insights and disparities in daily life.

items.title: The self-proclaimed Islamic State group is active globally. Where is it located now?
items.summary: Two flags linked to the self-proclaimed Islamic State group were found in the car used by the alleged shooters during Sunday's attack at Bondi Beach.

items.title: Frydenberg lashes Albanese and says Bondi terror attack 'greatest stain on the nation'
items.summary: Treasurer Jim Chalmers said he took his predecessor's views "seriously" and the government would "take suggestions from him".

items.title: Murders, terrorism: Dozens of charges laid against alleged 24-year-old Bondi gunman
items.summary: Naveed Akram was shot by police at the scene and spent days in a coma before being charged.

items.title: 'Act of war': Trump orders blockade of 'sanctioned' Venezuela oil tankers
items.summary: Donald Trump appears to be ramping up pressure on Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro, whom he called "illegitimate".

items.title: Nick Reiner's three-word remark as he appears in court on murder charges
items.summary: If convicted as charged, Nick Reiner would face life in prison without the possibility of parole, or the ‍death penalty.

items.title: NSW parliament to be recalled over 'urgent' gun reform and updated protest laws
items.summary: NSW Premier Chris Minns said parliament will be recalled next week to debate a multi-faceted gun reform bill.

items.title: Amandeep ate a kebab as the sun set — then helped stop one of the alleged Bondi shooters
items.summary: One of the many heroes who sprang into action after Sunday's attack says "now, more than ever, we need each other".

items.title: I have never earned more money, but I've never felt more broke
items.summary: Chris Booy works three jobs. Despite this, he says that the Great Australian Dream of owning a home is feeling increasingly out of reach.

items.title: Opposition puts migration policy on ice after Bondi Beach massacre
items.summary: The Opposition will instead prioritise the formation of an antisemitism and counter-terrorism taskforce.

items.title: 'Different blind spots': Where are the gaps in Australia's gun laws?
items.summary: The Bondi Beach massacre has renewed focus on Australia's gun laws, nearly three decades after the Port Arthur reforms.

items.title: Alleged Bondi gunmen travelled to Philippines, 'aligned' with terrorist group, police say
items.summary: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said during a press conference on Tuesday that the attack appeared to be "inspired by" the self-proclaimed Islamic State (IS).

items.title: How to cope during a heatwave in Australia
items.summary: Summer in Australia can be very hot, and as our climate continues to warm, heatwaves are expected to become more frequent and more intense. In this episode of Australia Explained, we cover what a heatwave is, why they pose such a significant risk to human health, who is at most risk, and how to best prepare to cope with a heatwave.
